TempSED 0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Heat fluxes between the air and sediment (positive = into sediment).

    flux_heat.Rd

    flux_heat calculates the different contributions of the heat budget and the total heat flux.

    flux_latent calculates the heat flux due to evaporation.

    flux_evaporation calculates the evaporation flux.

    flux_sensible calculates the heat flux due to conduction.

    flux_backradiation calculates the heat flux due to net longwave radation.

    flux_heat (T_air = 10, T_sed = 11, P = 101325, Wind = 0,
             Cloudiness = 0.5, Qrel = 0.01, 
             em_air = 0.8, em_sed = 0.95, stanton = 0.001, dalton = 0.0014, 
             por0 = 1,
             NLR = c("basic", "may86", "josey97", "bunker76", "bignami95"))                               

flux_latent (T_air = 10, T_sed = 11, P = 101325,
             Wind = 0, Qrel = 0.01, dalton = 0.0014, por0 = 1)
                
flux_evaporation(T_air = 10, T_sed = 11, P = 101325,
             Wind = 0, Qrel = 0.01, dalton = 0.0014, por0 = 1)

flux_sensible (T_air = 10, T_sed = 11, P = 101325,
             Wind = 0, Qrel = 0.01, stanton = 0.001)

flux_backradiation (T_air = 10, T_sed = 11, P = 101325, 
             Cloudiness = 0.5, Qrel = 0.01, em_air = 0.8, em_sed   = 0.95,
             NLR = c("basic", "may86", "josey97", "bunker76", "bignami95"))

    Arguments

    T_air

    The temperature of the air, one number or a vector, units [dgC].

    T_sed

    The temperature of the sediment near the surface, one number or a vector, units [dgC].

    P

    The air pressure, one number or a vector, units [Pa].

    Qrel

    The relative air humidity, a fraction relative to saturated, one number or a vector, units [-]; values should be inbetween 0 and 1 (not checked).

    Wind

    The velocity of the wind, estimated 10m above the surface, one number or a vector, units [m/s].

    por0

    The volumetric water content (volume water/volume bulk) of sediment near the surface. One number or a vector, units [-].

    em_air, em_sed

    Emissivity of Air (em_air) and emissivity of Water/sediment; unitless, one value.

    stanton, dalton

    Transfer coeff for sensible heat (stanton) and for latent heat (dalton); unitless, one value.

    Cloudiness

    The fraction of the sky covered by clouds; one number or a vector, units [-], values should be inbetween 0 and 1 (not checked).

    NLR

    How the backradiation should be estimated; a value between 1 and 5 or one of "basic" (= 1: Bolzmann), "may86" (=2), "josey97" (=3), "bunker76" (=4), "bignami95" (=5); see details.

    Value

    function flux_heat returns a list with:

    • evaporation, the rate of evaporation, [kg/m2/s]

    • latent_heat, the LATENT heat flux (due to evaporation), [W/m2]

    • sensible_heat, the SENSIBLE heat flux (due to conduction), [W/m2]

    • backradiation, the Net Longwave Radiation, [W/m2]

    • total, latent_heat + sensible_heat + backradiation, [W/m2]

    function flux_evaporation returns :

    • the rate of evaporation, [kg/m2/s]

    function flux_latent returns :

    • the LATENT heat flux (due to evaporation), [W/m2]

    function flux_sensible returns:

    • the SENSIBLE heat flux (due to conduction), [W/m2]

    function flux_backradiation returns:

    • the Net Longwave Radiation, [W/m2]

    The object attributes contain:

    • A description of these variables, including their units

    • the input parameter settings

    use attibutes(object)$description and attibutes(object)$parameters to extract it.

    Author

    Karline Soetaert

    Details

    See vignette("TempSED") for a description of the formulations used.

    Note

    Latent heat is the heat lost when the fluid evaporates.

    Sensible heat is the heat required to change the temperature without changing the phase.

    Backradiation is the amount of heat radiated from the atmosphere to the surface.

    References

    Bunker, A. F., 1976. Computations of surface energy flux and annual air-sea interaction cycles of the North Atlantic Ocean, Mon. Weather Rev., 104, 1122–1140.

    Bignami, F., S. Marullo, R. Santoleri, and M.E. Schiano, 1995. Longwave radiation budget in the Mediterranean Sea, J. Geophys. Res., 100(C2), 2501–2514.

    Clark, N.E., L. Eber, R.M. Laurs, J.A. Renner, and J.F.T. Saur, 1974. Heat exchange between ocean and atmosphere in the eastern North Pacific for 1961-71, NOAA Tech. Rep. NMFS SSRF-682, U.S. Dep. of Commer., Washington, D. C., 1974.

    Josey, S.A., D. Oakley, and R.W. Pascal, 1997. On estimating the atmospheric longwave flux at the ocean surface from ship meteorological reports. J. Geophys. Res., 102(C13), 27961–27972.

    Onken, R., H. Garbe, S. Schroder, and M. Janik, 2010. A new instrument for sediment temperature measurements. J Mar Sci Technol 15:427–433, DOI 10.1007/s00773-010-0096-8

    J.P. Rinehimer and J.T. Thomson, 2014. Observations and modeling of heat fluxes on tidal flats. J. Geophys. Res.: oceans, 119, 133–146, doi:10.1002/2013JC009225

    T.-W. Kim,1 Yang-Ki Cho and E.P. Dever, 2007. An evaluation of the thermal properties and albedo of a macrotidal flat. J. Geophys. Res., 112 (C12009), doi:10.1029/2006JC004015.

    See also

    air_properties. water_properties. mineral_properties. bulk_properties.

    Examples

    
# ---------------------------------------------------------
# The defaults
# ---------------------------------------------------------

flux_sensible()
#> [1] -1.760146e-308
#> attr(,"description")
#>           names                            description units
#> 1 sensible_heat SENSIBLE heat flux (due to conduction)  W/m2
#> attr(,"parameters")
#>     names mean.values                      description units
#> 1   T_air      10.000                  air temperature   dgC
#> 2   T_sed      11.000             sediment temperature   dgC
#> 3       P  101325.000                     air pressure    Pa
#> 4    Wind       0.000                       wind speed   m/s
#> 5    Qrel       0.010            relative air humidity     -
#> 6 stanton       0.001 transfer coeff for sensible heat     -
attributes(flux_sensible())  # Metadata
#> $description
#>           names                            description units
#> 1 sensible_heat SENSIBLE heat flux (due to conduction)  W/m2
#> 
#> $parameters

#> 1   T_air      10.000                  air temperature   dgC

# ---------------------------------------------------------
# Sequences of values
# ---------------------------------------------------------

# temperature, wind and relative humidity sequences
t.seq   <- seq(from = 0, to = 20, length.out = 100)
W.seq   <- seq(from = 0, to = 20, length.out = 100)
Q.seq   <- seq(from = 0, to = 1,  length.out = 100)

# sensible heat flux

sH.t.seq <- flux_sensible(T_air = t.seq)
sH.Q.seq <- flux_sensible(Qrel  = Q.seq)
sH.W.seq <- flux_sensible(Wind  = W.seq)
#> Warning: row names were found from a short variable and have been discarded

# latent heat flux
lH.t.seq <- flux_latent(T_air = t.seq)
lH.Q.seq <- flux_latent(Qrel  = Q.seq)
lH.W.seq <- flux_latent(Wind  = W.seq)
#> Warning: row names were found from a short variable and have been discarded

# Show results

par(mfrow = c(2,3), las = 1)

plot(t.seq, sH.t.seq,     
     xlab = "Temp, dgC", ylab = "W/m2", 
     main = "sensible heat flux")

plot(Q.seq, sH.Q.seq, 
     xlab = "rel humidity, -", ylab = "W/m2", 
     main = "sensible heat flux")

plot(W.seq, sH.W.seq, 
     xlab = "Wind speed, m/s", ylab = "W/m2", 
     main = "sensible heat flux")

plot(t.seq, lH.t.seq,     
     xlab = "Temp, dgC", ylab = "W/m2", 
     main = "latent heat flux")

plot(Q.seq, lH.Q.seq, 
      xlab = "rel humidity, -", ylab = "W/m2", 
      main = "latent heat flux")

plot(W.seq, lH.W.seq, 
      xlab = "Wind speed, m/s", ylab = "W/m2", 
      main = "latent heat flux")


# Backradiation

BR.t.seq <- flux_backradiation(T_air = t.seq)

# show differences between the different formulations!

c(flux_backradiation(NLR = 1), flux_backradiation(NLR = 2), 
  flux_backradiation(NLR = 3), flux_backradiation(NLR = 4), 
  flux_backradiation(NLR = 5)) 
#> [1]  -59.58611 -127.56651 -109.58421  -59.72490 -102.42845

# ---------------------------------------------------------
# All air-sediment exchange fluxes
# ---------------------------------------------------------

# The default:
flux_heat()
#>   evaporation   latent_heat sensible_heat backradiation         total 
#>  1.398274e-05 -3.460715e+01 -1.252820e+00 -5.958611e+01 -9.544608e+01

#> 4 backradiation Net Longwave Radiation (backradiation)    W/m2
#> 5         total  latentHeat+sensibleHeat+backradiation    W/m2
#> attr(,"parameters")
#>         names mean.values                      description units

# One value
flux_heat(T_air = 20)
#>   evaporation   latent_heat sensible_heat backradiation         total 
#>  1.338886e-05 -3.313730e+01  1.089030e+01 -1.616313e+01 -3.841012e+01 
#> attr(,"description")
#>           names                            description   units
#> 1   evaporation                    rate of evaporation kg/m2/s
#> 2   latent_heat  LATENT heat flux (due to evaporation)    W/m2
#> 3 sensible_heat SENSIBLE heat flux (due to conduction)    W/m2
#> 4 backradiation Net Longwave Radiation (backradiation)    W/m2
#> 5         total  latentHeat+sensibleHeat+backradiation    W/m2
#> attr(,"parameters")
#>         names mean.values                      description units
#> 1       T_air     20.0000                  air temperature   dgC
#> 2       T_sed     11.0000             sediment temperature   dgC
#> 3           P 101325.0000                     air pressure    Pa
#> 4        Wind      0.0000                       wind speed   m/s
#> 5  Cloudiness      0.5000    relative fraction cloud cover     -
#> 6        Qrel      0.0100            relative air humidity     -
#> 7      em_air      0.8000                emissivity of Air     -
#> 8      em_sed      0.9500     emissivity of water/sediment     -
#> 9      dalton      0.0014   transfer coeff for latent heat     -
#> 10    stanton      0.0010 transfer coeff for sensible heat     -
#> 11       por0      1.0000        surface sediment porosity     -
#> attr(,"settings")
#>   name           description value
#> 1  NLR backradiation formula basic

# a sequence of temperature values
SS <- sapply(X   = t.seq, 
             FUN = function(T) flux_heat(T_air = T))

SS <- rbind(temperature = t.seq, SS)
SS[,1:3]
#>                        [,1]          [,2]          [,3]
#> temperature    0.000000e+00  2.020202e-01  4.040404e-01
#> evaporation    1.456387e-05  1.455210e-05  1.454033e-05
#> latent_heat   -3.604544e+01 -3.601630e+01 -3.598717e+01
#> sensible_heat -1.428587e+01 -1.401314e+01 -1.374080e+01
#> backradiation -9.864416e+01 -9.789631e+01 -9.714681e+01
#> total         -1.489755e+02 -1.479258e+02 -1.468748e+02
